direction.raw_text: He shakes hands with Iles for second, then Iles goes out abruptly. Outside we can hear abrupt commands to the Sergeant before the door closes. Haven takes out his pipe, looks at the silent, dumb-struck Mrs Caslon. He smiles at her slightly. She gets her voice at last.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside "To Horse" is sounding. Haven glances out the window, hardly aware of Mrs Caslon's presence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes to the desk, gets it and hands it to him. He takes the gun from his holster and hands it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts his own gun in holster. Glances out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pats her shoulder in a gesture of goodbye and walks out the door. She stands watching him, then moves to the window and looks out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I guess I owe you an apology.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (extending his hand) I'll take it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . CASLON I guess I owe you something too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only fifty thousand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . CASLON I wish there was something I could say or do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is. You can give me back my gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you can give this one back to the sheriff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . CASLON I'll always remember what a fool I made of myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) I always try to forget.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . CASLON (watching his face) Are you going too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not with them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Haven walks outside towards his waiting horse. He pauses, pipe in mouth, lighting the pipe now, his face intensely interested as he watches the men form on the parade ground in front of the mounted Iles and Stellman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of soldiers. As they mount to a brisk command, and the color bearer takes position. Iles barks out a command; the column forms into marching order. On the double quick, the cavalry company starts out and on the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Haven as he watches; his eyes lighting a little, the pipe in hand. We feel that he'd like to go too in this moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from Haven's view, as the column of cavalry departs. Haven waves his hand, a half salute, a half gesture to Iles as Iles salutes him in passing. Then only the dust remains and Haven's gaze lingers. His face changes. It becomes grim. He slowly knocks the ashes from the pipe, pockets it. He slowly mounts the horse. He takes out his gun and checks it. Then slowly he rides away, like a man on a mission he dislikes but cannot evade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Mrs. Caslon looks out the window. Her face, tense, as she watches the lonely figure go; her hand waves slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHARLIE'S OFFICE - DAWN Charlie is standing by the desk and window. Prince is sitting there, talking, the inevitable dice in his fingers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There's seventy men ready for any kind of play. I say we can still swing it -- and get out of town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is SOUND of massed horses outside and Charlie looks out. Prince walks to the window. They look in silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Can we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Iles rides by at full gallop, followed by a troop of cavalry, headed for the sawmill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they watch. Prince turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prince crosses to the window and stands looking at Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie looks at him but does not answer and then she turns to the window, and smiles slightly. Prince follows her gaze to the street. His face is grim.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You wanted to give Haven time. Well, he took it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You better get out before he takes you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By that I presume you intend to remain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wistfully) I've been here as long as I remember.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I asked you once if Haven moved me out. (he smiles) I think he's moved us both out -- together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Haven, mounted, is coming up the street. Slowly and carefully he progresses to the front of the saloon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Charlie glances at Prince.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and goes quietly and swiftly from the room. Charlie stands thoughtfully. There is nothing in her look or manner to indicate that what Prince has said has made the slightest impression on her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) This is the way I wanted it... and when I've finished you will too... as though Haven had never been here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Haven comes up to the saloon door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SALOON DAWN As Prince moves into a shadowy corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON the door as Haven enters and looks around. He sees no one. The place seems utterly deserted. It is soundless. CAMERA FOLLOWS Haven as he moves slowly. He has replaced the gun, but he is alert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON Prince as he watches Haven, now a perfect target, not looking in his direction. Prince raises the gun a little, but the dice in his over hand click ever so faintly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven as he stops dead in his tracks, hand on the gun again, alert at the slight sound of the dice. Now facing towards the shadow where Prince is hidden. He stands ready and rigid for a long still moment. When there is no further sound or movement, he goes on towards the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON Prince as he moves slightly from the shadow as Haven goes to the stairs. Prince is ready to shoot again, but now the angle on Haven up the stairs is no good. He lowers the gun with disgust, then moves softly out of the shadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gets a gun out of the drawer, looks at it, smiles, drops it back into the drawer, moves around the desk and faces the door, composing herself and waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Haven pauses, pushes it open. Then walks slowly in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is standing with her back to the desk, her fingers tight on the edge of the desk as Haven walks in. He stops and looks around and then at her. There is a slight smile on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands her the little derringer she had given to Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She puts the little gun on the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands her the paper he showed Iles. She just glances at it without touching it. Smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes pass him towards the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the bare rustle of SOUND behind him (and the memory of her eyes going past him) Haven whirls, stopping aside and drawing as he does so. And just as he does so, Prince, in the doorway, fires. Haven shoots so that the shots RING OUT almost simultaneously. Prince topples forward on his knees and then his face. The dice roll out of his unclenched left hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You cause me an awful lot of trouble.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh... but I finally brought you something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't really think Mark would use it, did you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I just wanted to send you a gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thoughtfully) Maybe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't it a little late to make any difference?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's pretty late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to arrest you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Murder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I could have killed you from the window -- but I didn't. And I didn't kill the two men -- or Goodard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who did?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe Mick -- maybe Prince -- who knows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'd almost as soon be killed as arrest me, wouldn't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Almost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which are you -- Wells Fargo or Army?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Army.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess it's my turn to wish you'd gone to China.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish I had too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) If you still have that gold, and I think you do, we might make it yet. You see I believe that every man has his price.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some men don't believe that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But every woman knows it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only there wouldn't be any women on my jury. (taking out his pipe) And that's why you're not as bad off as you might think... I could find twelve men who might think you capable of almost anything -- but I wouldn't bet they'd vote that way after staring at you through a trial. (he notes her eyes go past him) Mick is dead for the murders and Prince can be hung for the rest of it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of Haven and Charlie as their eyes read the dice. Haven puts away the gun. Charlie is still leaning against the desk, but there is a strange look on her face. A thin smile for Haven. Now she sags a little and Haven realizes she has been hit. He starts to her and she turns away towards the couch. He catches her as she sags again, and helps her down gently on the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on couch as Haven kneels beside her. He starts to pull away the top of her dress, but the wound is close to the heart. She shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven knows it. He takes her hand and squeezes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven stares grimly at her face. She gives him a faint smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She holds herself tight a moment; then looks at him again, the faint smile returning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She starts to die. He takes her shoulders in his hands as though to kiss her or hold her back to life. Her voice is almost a whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes, slumping back. He sits there, pats her shoulder in a familiar absent-minded way, then slowly rises. Grimly, Haven walks out of the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's no good...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll get someone -- CHARLIE Stay here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me something...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This gets us all. This doesn't count.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) No...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me something -- on the square.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you ever -- love me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All the time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a whisper) Tell it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From the first night and the first time of the song. I tried to get away from it, but every time it came back. Every time I tried to get it out of my brain I just pushed it deeper into my heart. It had to be either you or me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all right. I love you... (as he looks hard at her) Well -- say it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) I love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See you... in China.
dialogue.name: dialogue
